results.title: Expression of Cyr61 in ApoE-/- mice with chronic unilateral renal artery ligation
results.text_hl: Male @GENE_APOE @GENE_348 @@@ApoE@@@-/- @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ were randomized to surgically induced @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@RAS@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@RAS@@@ + treatment with either @CHEMICAL_Irbesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077405 @@@irbesartan@@@, @CHEMICAL_aliskiren @CHEMICAL_MESH:C446481 @@@aliskiren@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ or sham-surgery.

citations.NLM: Pathak AS, Rojas M, Stouffer GA. Expression of Cyr61 in ApoE-/- mice with chronic unilateral renal artery ligation Sci Rep. 2021 Feb 11;11(1):3606. PMID: 33574403
citations.BibTeX: @article{33574403, title={Expression of Cyr61 in ApoE-/- mice with chronic unilateral renal artery ligation}, author={Pathak AS and Rojas M and Stouffer GA}, journal={Sci Rep}, volume={11}, number={1}, pages={3606}}

results.title: Spontaneous Extracranial Internal Carotid Artery Dissection Solely Presenting with Sudden Onset Pulsatile Tinnitus.
results.text_hl: Administration of 5 mg/day @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and 100 mg/day @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ was initiated.

citations.NLM: Okada T, Hamada H, Tanaka S, Yamamoto M, Fujio S, Hanaya R, Arita K. Spontaneous Extracranial Internal Carotid Artery Dissection Solely Presenting with Sudden Onset Pulsatile Tinnitus. NMC Case Rep J. 2025;12():349-354. PMID: 40979076

results.title: A Case of Bilateral Renal Artery Fibromuscular Dysplasia in a U.S. Soldier.
results.text_hl: Doppler ultrasound and CT angiography revealed bilateral @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@renal artery stenosis@@@ with a characteristic "beaded" appearance, consistent with multifocal @DISEASE_Fibromuscular_Dysplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D005352 @@@FMD@@@.

citations.NLM: Delamare B, DeNunzio T. A Case of Bilateral Renal Artery Fibromuscular Dysplasia in a U.S. Soldier. Mil Med. 2025 Jun 10;():. PMID: 40493546
citations.BibTeX: @article{40493546, title={A Case of Bilateral Renal Artery Fibromuscular Dysplasia in a U.S. Soldier.}, author={Delamare B and DeNunzio T}, journal={Mil Med}}

results.title: Acute idiopathic polyradiculoneuritis with secondary arterial hypertension in a 5-year-old male Siberian Husky
results.text_hl: Heart rate variability analysis indicated decreased vagal activity (low root-mean-square values of successive RR interval differences and percentages of the RR intervals differing by more than 50 ms in the entire recording) and predominance of sympathetic activity. @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@Arterial@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ was treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ but remained greater than the upper limit for 51 days until the @SPECIES_9615 @@@dog@@@ recovered ambulation.

citations.NLM: Musteata M, Ștefănescu R, Baisan AR, Mocanu D, Pașca SA, Hrițcu LD, Henea M, Solcan G. Acute idiopathic polyradiculoneuritis with secondary arterial hypertension in a 5-year-old male Siberian Husky Vet Q. 2020 Dec;40(1):223-228. PMID: 32886034
citations.BibTeX: @article{32886034, title={Acute idiopathic polyradiculoneuritis with secondary arterial hypertension in a 5-year-old male Siberian Husky}, author={Musteata M and Ștefănescu R and Baisan AR and Mocanu D and Pașca SA and Hrițcu LD and Henea M and Solcan G}, journal={Vet Q}, volume={40}, number={1}, pages={223-228}}

results.title: Renal artery stenosis towards the year 2000.
results.text_hl: Interim analysis of an ongoing prospective multicentre study in the Netherlands indicates that the prevalence of @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@renal artery stenosis@@@ is as high as 25% in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who are resistant to the combination of 10 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ + 50 mg @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, compared with 15% in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ resistant to the combination of 20 mg @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ + 25 mg @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@.

citations.NLM: Derkx FH, van Jaarsveld BC, Krijnen P, Man in 't Veld AJ, van den Meiracker AH, Schalekamp MA. Renal artery stenosis towards the year 2000. J Hypertens Suppl. 1996 Dec;14(5):S167-72. PMID: 9120674
citations.BibTeX: @article{9120674, title={Renal artery stenosis towards the year 2000.}, author={Derkx FH and van Jaarsveld BC and Krijnen P and Man in 't Veld AJ and van den Meiracker AH and Schalekamp MA}, journal={J Hypertens Suppl}, volume={14}, number={5}, pages={S167-72}}

results.title: [Comparative study of spirapril (quadropril) and amlodipine efficacy. Results of randomized trial in patients with mild to moderate arterial hypertension].
results.text_hl: AIM: To compare in the non-blind randomised parallel study the efficiency of @CHEMICAL_spirapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C052555 @@@quadropril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ in the treatment of mild to moderate @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@arterial@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Shal'nova SA, Martsevich SIu, Deev AD, Kutishenko NP, Kukushkin SK, Manoshkina EM, Alimova EV, Semenova IuE, Lebedev AV, Koniakhina IP, Zagrebel'nyĭ AV. results.title: Amlodipine, but not verapamil or nifedipine, dilates rabbit femoral artery largely through a nitric oxide- and kinin-dependent mechanism.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@, but not @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@, dilates @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbit@@@ femoral @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@artery@@@ largely through a @CHEMICAL_Nitric_Oxide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009569 @@@nitric oxide@@@- and kinin-dependent mechanism.

citations.NLM: Xu B, Xiao-hong L, Lin G, Queen L, Ferro A. Amlodipine, but not verapamil or nifedipine, dilates rabbit femoral artery largely through a nitric oxide- and kinin-dependent mechanism. Br J Pharmacol. 2002 Jun;136(3):375-82. PMID: 12023940

results.title: Effect of Ca2+ channel blockers on arterial hypertension and heart ischaemic lesions induced by chronic blockade of nitric oxide in the rat.
results.text_hl: The effects of the Ca2+ channel blockers @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@, @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ were investigated on both @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@arterial@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Nephrosis_Lipoid @DISEASE_MESH:D009402 @@@myocardial changes@@@ induced by chronic blockade of @CHEMICAL_Nitric_Oxide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009569 @@@nitric oxide@@@ synthesis.

citations.NLM: de Oliveira CF, Nathan LP, Metze K, Moreno H Jr, de Luca IM, Sucupira M, Zatz R, Zappellini A, Antunes E, de Nucci G. results.title: Effect of amlodipine and hormone replacement therapy on blood pressure and bone markers in menopause.
results.text_hl: The aim of this study was to observe the effect of an 8-week treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, alone or in combination with hormone replacement therapy (HRT), on blood pressure (BP), serum @GENE_BGLAP @GENE_632 @@@osteocalcin@@@, bone-specific alkaline phosphatase (B-ALP) and urine deoxypiridinoline in @DISEASE_Osteoporotic_Fractures @DISEASE_MESH:D058866 @@@postmenopausal osteoporotic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with mild-to-moderate @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@arterial@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Zacharieva S, Shigarminova R, Nachev E, Kamenov Z, Atanassova I, Orbetzova M, Stoynev A, Doncheva N, Borissova AM. Effect of amlodipine and hormone replacement therapy on blood pressure and bone markers in menopause. Methods Find Exp Clin Pharmacol. 2003 Apr;25(3):209-13. PMID: 12743626

results.title: The safe introduction of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor in renal allograft recipients.
results.text_hl: At least 2 months after transplantation, we exchanged @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (5 mg) for either @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@perindopril@@@ (5 mg) in 25 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who were free of @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@renal artery stenosis@@@ as determined indirectly by measuring the renal arterial resistance index with the noninvasive, inexpensive Doppler ultrasound method.

citations.NLM: Wagner L, Fekete A, Rudolf A, Doros A, Langer RM. The safe introduction of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor in renal allograft recipients. Transplant Proc. 2012 Sep;44(7):2151-3. PMID: 22974939
